title: Tickets on sale this week for UFC 245 with three title fights in Las Vegas
text:
The UFC will close out its pay-per-view schedule for 2019 with a top-heavy card in its home base, like usual.

UFC 245 is set for Dec. 14 at T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas. The main card airs on pay-per-view following prelims on ESPN2 and UFC Fight Pass/ESPN+. And the card is heavy with title fights – three of them.

In the main event, welterweight champion Kamaru Usman (15-1 MMA, 10-0 UFC) will defend his title for the first time against challenger and heated rival Colby Covington (15-1 MMA, 10-1 UFC).

In the co-feature, featherweight champion Max Holloway (21-4 MMA, 17-4 UFC) puts his title on the line against challenger Alexander Volkanovski (20-1 MMA, 7-0 UFC), who is unbeaten in the UFC.

And the three title fights kick off with dual women’s champion Amanda Nunes (18-4 MMA, 11-1 UFC) putting her bantamweight title up for grabs against former women’s featherweight champ Germaine de Randamie (9-3 MMA, 6-1 UFC).

Tickets for UFC 245 are on sale to the general public Friday at 1 p.m. ET (10 a.m. PT local time) through AXS.com or the arena box office. There is an eight-ticket limit. Ticket prices have not been announced.

UFC Fight Club members can purchase tickets Wednesday via ufcfightclub.com beginning at 1 p.m. ET. UFC e-newsletter subscribers can purchase tickets Thursday at 1 p.m. ET.

The latest UFC 245 lineup includes:

Champ Kamaru Usman vs. Colby Covington – for welterweight title

Champ Max Holloway vs. Alexander Volkanovski – for featherweight title

Champ Amanda Nunes vs. Germaine de Randamie – for women’s bantamweight title

Matt Brown vs. Ben Saunders

Jessica Eye vs. Viviane Araujo

Kai Kara-France vs. Brandon Moreno

Oskar Piechota vs. Punahele Soriano

description: The UFC will close out its pay-per-view schedule for 2019 with a top-heavy card in its home base, like usual.
